relation: Walk in the locality. Waterproofs & boots
pageTitle: Kirkhill Cub Scouts | Kirkhill & Bunchrew Community
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {14902=Firstly, Cubs will start back on Tuesday 28th April in the Community Centre at 6:30 pm. There will be a short parents’ meeting about the PGL Camp, followed by a Games Night., 16359=We have been asked to help the National Trust for Scotland to produce a new banner for the visitors centre at Culloden. This will require the Cubs to visit the battlefield and examine the flora and fauna there and then draw what the found. The banner will then be produced from their drawings and used to decorate the educational area. It is planned that we will be visiting Culloden on 13 June. More details will be available nearer the time., 17910=E-mail: kirkhill.cubs@hotmail.co.uk David Hendry (Leader): 831114, Dave Knox (Assistant leader): 831500 Antonia Macdonald (Assistant leader): 831112, 22084=© 2011-13 Kirkhill and Bunchrew Community Trust / Company limited by guarantee Registered in Scotland No. 199977, Scottish Charity No. SCO 29389, 15147=We will be going to PGL Dalguise for camp on the weekend of 1-3 May. The bus will be leaving from Kirkhill Primary School at 4:30pm. Cubs should be at the school by 4:15pm in order to load their luggage into the trailer. A suggested kit list was circulated but it can be found by following this link. Cubs should travel in uniform. Please be aware that eating and drinking is not permitted on the bus., 15756=The bus will return to Kirkhill Primary School on Sunday 3 May at approximately 8:00pm, although this timing is subject to change.}
textBeforeTable: Activity Calendar – Summer 2015 E-mail: kirkhill.cubs@hotmail.co.uk David Hendry (Leader): 831114, Dave Knox (Assistant leader): 831500 Antonia Macdonald (Assistant leader): 831112 Contact Finally, thank you for your support over the year. If you would like to help out with the Cubs, either as a uniformed leader or on a more irregular basis, please ask any one of the leaders. It is both rewarding and enjoyable and a role we would recommend to anyone. Parent Helpers Term fees are due on the first week back. These are £20 for existing Cubs and £25 for new Cubs, to cover investiture. These can be paid either using the online system or in cash or by cheque, if you prefer. Be aware that the payment system may send out emails even if you have paid manually. In that case, you can ignore the request for payment. Term Fees As you may be aware, Kirkhill Church has a new minister, Dr Jonathan Humphrey. We would like to extend a warm Scouting welcome to Dr Humphrey and his family. It is hoped that he will be coming to visit us some time this term to see what the Cubs get up to. We have been asked to help the National Trust for Scotland to produce a new banner for the visitors centre at Culloden. This will require the Cubs to visit the battlefield and examine the flora and fauna there and then draw what
